result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Lee Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Defendant's pro se request to vacate DNA surcharge.
Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing FEBRUARY 6, 2015, received and filed. (30 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  INSTITUTION PER STATUTE

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made by Jamika J.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 9 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 2 and 3; credit for 241 days served.  Court ordered 5 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 4 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 1 and 3; credit for 241 days served.  Court ordered 3 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 3 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 3 YEARS 6 MONTHSin the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2; credit for 241 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.

Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No violent contact with victim or any children.  No living together unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

AS TO COUNTS 4 AND 5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3 AS AMENDED AND TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancers, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Robert Lee Daniels not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 01-20-2015 in Branch 40.  Discussions regarding additional discovery received by defendse.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
from Attorney Richard Voss received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for status of counsel.  The public defender's office has not been anyone to take this case yet.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case recalled.  Court started to take a plea from the defendant when the defendant made certain allegations against counsel.  After speaking with the defendant and counsel, Court removed Attorney Kuehn as attorney of record.  Court advised defendant this will be the last public defender appointed.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Defense informed the Court they would like a Court trial.  Defense examined by the Court as to his right to a jury trial and found defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a jury.  Case passed.
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 10/13/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
from the defense received and filed.  rmm
from the defense received and filed.  rmm

received and filed.  rmm

COUNT 5:  ATTEMPT FIRST DEGREE INTENTIONAL HOMICIDE, DOMESTIC ABUSE, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.01(1)(a), 939.50(3)(a), 939.32, 968.075(1)(a), a Class B Felony.

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defense just received a new offer and would like another date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Lori A. Kuehn in court, defendant Robert Lee Daniels not in court, in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Lori A. Kuehn in court, defendant Robert Lee Daniels not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 FILE NOT IN COURT.  
New defense counsel needs to obtain discovery from prior counsel.  Due to the assignment of ADA Michael Schindhelm, this case is assigned to Branch 40.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 40 on 8-12-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court with attorney Eugene J. Dietzler.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Dietzler informs the court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable and defendant is requesting new counsel.  Motion of defense counsel to withdraw as counsel is heard and granted by the Court.  Attorney Dietzler is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel will need to be appointed.  Defendant waived Speedy Trial until new attorney is appointed.  Court advised defendant that this will be his last appointment for new counsel.  State is requesting that the case be reassigned to Branch 40, due to the assignment of ADA Schindelm.  The Court will review the request by the State to transfer case to Branch 40 on the next date.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40 on 7-28-2014 at 1:30 pm.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 7-28-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Attorney Eugene J. Dietzler in court, defendant Robert Lee Daniels not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 7-21-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.   mld

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court with attorney Eugene J Dietzler.  Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Kurt Ziarnik.  Exhibit 1 received.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty to the four counts.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery from the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-11-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 7-21-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLD dob 1/18/13 or Jamika J.

Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Robert Lee Daniels in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
